body.description: 3.5-INCH 10TB DESKTOP HARD DRIVES Unrivaled Desktop Legacy Built on proven reliability and innovation, MDD 10TB Desktop hard drives are available in a versatile mix of capacity and price point options to fit any budget MULTI-TIER CACHING TECHNOLOGY Optimized Read and Write Data Flow All hard drives in the MDD 10TB Hard Drive come equipped with Multi-Tier Caching Technology (MTC). MTC takes your PC to new performance levels so you can load applications and files faster than ever before. MDD 10TB HDD delivers improved read and write performance by optimizing data flow with intelligent layers of NAND Flash, DRAM, and media cache technologies. YOUR DATA MATTERS TO US Key Advantages Highest capacity. 10TB means you get the highest storage capacity available in the 3.5-inch PC class. Peace of mind. A 3-year limited warranty and 300TB/year workload limit means this drive has your back. Incredible speed. Delivers 7200-RPM spin speed along with sustained data rates up to 250MB/s and burst data rates of 6Gb/s. Energy efficient. This drive is one of the lowest-power 3.5-inch drives on the market. Optimized for creative pros. Designed and tuned for creative applications, these drives feature higher random performance and drive reliability than typical PC compute drives.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 3.8 3.8 out of 5 stars 30 ratings 3.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Needed storage for a NAS that had a failed drive...
reviews.reviewText: Even though these are apparently refurbished drives, I needed relatively inexpensive drives to replace drives on a NAS which failed. After evacuating the data off the NAS, which is a two drive model, then adding these drives, rebuilding the array and restoring the data, these work well. The drives had zero hours on them from SMART, and the NAS appliance I used them with was easily able to work with them in a RAID 1 configuration. So far, they have been in constant use after purchase, and definitely no complaints, errors or other glitches. Definitely will be buying some more when it comes time for some capacity upgrades for network storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Drive was different than label
reviews.reviewText: The drive is clearly labeled a 10TB. However when I mounted it, it identified as a 12TB.Sadly because I'm using it in an UnRAID server, the largest drive in the array has to be the parity disk, which in my case was 10TB. I was using this to replace a failed 8TB disk.As such, I had to order another 10TB disk to replace the 8TB. I am currently in the process of swapping out the 10TB parity with this mis-labeled 12TB disk.Update: The drive is functional. It is a reburbished Seagate 12TB Enterprise drive. (Labeled as an MDD 10TB).The "hours used" shows 0 (brand new). So far, so good.UPDATE: The drive is working flawlessly so far. My only nits: It doesn't have drive-holes in the same places as other brands (such as WD, HGST). This MDD drive is a rebranded Seagate ST12000NM0127. It seems to be fine, my only other complaint is that this drive is LOUD. Even in a case with 10 other drives, THAT is the one I can hear from across the room. (But it's a server, who cares?)So far things are going well. I will update the review if anything else pops up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars DEFECTIVE Hard Drive
reviews.reviewText: Within 1 week of light use, this drive started sounding like a popcorn maker. This is one of the most obvious red flags for a failing hard drive. Terrible product quality if they are shipping defective drives out. DO NO BUY. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023

reviews.reviewText: Arrived as advertised, works well so far. Good price. I transferred 7+ TB backup to it without any problems.

reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Dont waste your $
reviews.reviewText: Worked great for 3months then deadlined. Lost 4tb of data. Warranty says 3years but you have to figure out who that is, true warranty seems to be 30days...learn from my loss
